body: LGTM, but I've been burned on bridge code before. Anyone else wants to take a close look?
@markusweimer @afchung Done with another round of comments fixes
I will look at it.
@dongjoon-hyun no problem! Thanks for the merge!
I completed a pass. It looks good with minor comments.
@afchung @markusweimer I removed that Map from interface following Andrew's suggestion.
Done with another pass over my prior comments.

Should we hold this change until 0.14 release is finalized? We'll need at least one change in .NET code to fix test failures, and there might be more. Not doing changes which rely on 0.14 being complete will simplify release manager's life. (Unfortunately, we've already done a couple of these)

@markusweimer I refactored the abstract class into composition and made runtime configurations composable so we won't need to implement a class for each combination of runtimes. Also fixed other comments. Please take a look, I think I got all the comments.

Hi, @yunseong . 
I think you need to test and commit this PR to both MASTER and 0.14 branch.
How do you think about this?
Hi @dongjoon-hyun, I agree that if this PR is merged, then it should be included in 0.14.0 as well. @tcNickolas I'll test it.
As #860 has been merged, the tests should pass for this PR as well. @markusweimer Could you kindly test this PR once again when you have time? Thanks!

@yunseong , you are back now! 
2AM in Seoul? :)
Will do.
.NET tests pass, will merge.

@dongjoon-hyun yes it was :)

@tcNickolas Tests passed with those changes both in Master and 0.14.0! Can someone please take a look at the code and merge it? Thanks!
Thanks @markusweimer! I also would like to thank @dongjoon-hyun and @jwang98052 for the help.
Okay, I will test and merge this for you, @yunseong . :)
I tested and merged to the master.
Thank you, @tcNickolas !
@markusweimer Pushed fixes for minor comments and replied for the questions you have raised.
@markusweimer do you see any additional blockers for this PR?
@jwang98052 It seems like there is only one relevant line to the JIRA. Can you create a separate JIRA item for the text renames and fixes? Thanks!

@shulmanb, can you please check that the current state of the branch still works on YARN? You probably should merge or rebase to current master locally before running that test to make sure it is indicative of the run after we merged this into master :)
Please _don't_ push the merged / rebased version. It will mess up the substantial discussion on this thread.
@markusweimer sure, will test now

@afchung  All the other changes are for TestSendTaskMessage that is to test the code change. Original test didn't really validate the message received, I am enhance the test for it. There are some test refactor in test base because I need to reuse some code in TestSendTaskMessage.  

I think code change should go together with test for the code.
@markusweimer Yarn tests passed, HelloReefMultiYarn passed.
If we need to do this every time when updating version, this should be part of `change_version.py`.
I will test the .NET side and merge.
@markusweimer Thanks.
LGTM. Will test and merge
Thank you so much!
Will use script to do it.
LGTM. I'll test and merge this.

@afchung This PR removes a lot of classes/fields deprecated by you. Could you please take a look? I'm interested in `MaxApplicationSubmissions`, since it's the only field that was still in use in code.
I'll test and merge
Tests pass, will merge.
@markusweimer could you advise on this? I don't think all our mentors are from Microsoft :-)
@tcNickolas Thank you for the note; I updated the request with the info I found on the Web.
@markusweimer @jwang98052 Sorry for the late update, I'll be addressing the comments today.
@markusweimer @jwang98052 Updated, please have another look. Thanks!
Oh, @afchung . It fails on CI. Let's continue after fixing that first. :)
@dongjoon-hyun Sorry, I only ran .NET tests prior to sending the PR. Let me fix the tests and close this first in the meantime. Thanks for the review!
@dongjoon-hyun I've updated the PR, addressing your comments and fixing the broken tests. Please have another look. Thanks!
Thank you for quick fixing, @afchung .

Sorry, @afchung .
The code looks good to me overall, but I couldn't pass the test due to the failure I wrote in dev mailing list.

I'm afraid I can't fix my build environment soon.
I hope some other committer help to finish to review and commit this.
Could you ask someone else explicitly, please?
I'll take a look at this.

This looks good to me. For `MaxApplicationSubmissions`, in my previous change, I moved it to not be Tang-based, provided that it is a submission-time parameter that should not be merged into a job runtime configuration in the first place. @tcNickolas do you have any concerns with it? If not, I'll test and merge. Thanks!
@jwang98052 This looks good, I'll test and merge. I'll fix the typos in your commit message as well.
My only concern was that I misread your intention for it, and you wanted it not deleted but made private or something.
Looks good, I'll merge
OK sounds good! I'll test and merge.
@anupam128 I'm done with a pass.
LGTM, I will test
@markusweimer made the change. Please take a look.
LGTM, will test and merge
I merged this. The mirror seems to be stuck again.
LGTM. Will test and merge
I rebased and force-pushed this.
@afchung Can you please resolve the merge conflicts here?
@markusweimer Resolved, thanks!
Do you have a test case for the change especially test running on YARN?
I will look at it.
Can you have a test case that covers multiple FailedContexts in a FailedEvaluator?
I complete a pass. Looks good with minor comments.

This code doesn't build for me

```
Error   14  No overload for method 'ValidateMessageSuccessfullyLogged' takes 2 arguments    C:\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Functional\Bridge\TestSuspendTask.cs  65  13  Org.Apache.REEF.Tests
```

Our new AppVeyor setup agrees with me :-) https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/reef/build/0.15.0-SNAPSHOT.7-master

Please revert the check-in or fix it.

Hi, @tcNickolas .
Please remove the change on `change_version.py`.
I've also leave some comments, too.
One more thing, could you take a look at the AppVeyor failure?
By the way, I really thank you for this PR.

I've already looked into it, we actually have a built failure on our master introduced by #867. I've reported it in that PR.

You're welcome :-) Judging from this build failure, we're in desperate need of .NET CI :-)
I've addressed the comments

Thank you. Everything looks good. I think we had better launch this first to start monitoring.
I'll merge this.
This fixes the issue and passes tests. AppVeyor test timeout is unrelated (as it was observed previously). I'll merge
I will address the issue in FailedEvaluator and test it.

I try to open O.A.R.VS2013.sln with VS 2013, and build fails:

```
Error   7   Invalid Resx file. Could not find a part of the path 'C:\reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.exe'. Line 79, position 5.    C:\reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.Client\Resources.resx 79  5   Org.Apache.REEF.Client
```

(followed by a bunch of "Metadata file could not be found", which I think are caused by failures to build earlier dlls)

The machine also has VS 2015 installed, if that is important.

Same machine, when I try to run 

```
msbuild .\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.VS2013.sln /p:Configuration="Debug" /p:Platform="x64" /m
```

with build tools for v120 (the same VS 2013 setup I'm using for builds now), it fails

```
   "C:\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.VS2013.sln" (default target) (1) ->
   "C:\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.IO.TestClient\Org.Apache.REEF.IO.TestClient.csproj" (default target) (17) ->
   "C:\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.vcxproj" (default target) (34) ->
   (PlatformPrepareForBuild target) ->
     C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V120\Microsoft.Cpp.Platform.targets(64,5): error MSB8020: Th
   e build tools for v140 (Platform Toolset = 'v140') cannot be found. To build using the v140 build tools, please
   install v140 build tools.  Alternatively, you may upgrade to the current Visual Studio tools by selecting the Pr
   oject menu or right-click the solution, and then selecting "Upgrade Solution...". [C:\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.RE
   EF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.vcxproj]
```
I ran HelloREEF .NET on Local and Yarn environments.
@markusweimer @afchung Please take a look when u have a chance.

-1 

There has been no discussion of this, the JIRA is essentially empty. Please add some description there that explains what this change is supposed to do and how it does it.
@markusweimer I updated the Jira with the description of this work.
Looking into it.

@tcNickolas I removed the `.VS2013.` files in the last commit. I believe the VS2015 files can be compiled from the command line via:

```
msbuild .\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.sln /p:Configuration="Debug" /p:Platform="x64" /p:PlatformToolse
t=v120 /m /tv:12.0
```

Can you give that a shot? Next step would be to somehow make VS 2013 call `msbuild` this way.
These parameters seem to work for command-line set up for VS 2013, and this change works with normal build command for VS 2015 (both from command-line and VS itself).
Yay! I am working on automating this now.

@tcNickolas I removed one command line parameter, and it works for me via:

```
msbuild .\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.sln /p:Configuration="Debug" /p:Platform="x64" /m /tv:12.0
```

Can you confirm?

I've replaced the commit in here with a new one that makes the solution compile on both VS 2013 and VS 2015 for me. We need to test this in a couple of environments:
- A machine with both VS 2013 and 2015 installed. @tcNickolas can you do that?
- A machine with only VS 2013 installed. @shulmanb Can you do that?
- A machine with only VS 2015 installed. I can do that.
I just tried on a machine with only VS 2015. Builds worked on both the command line and within VS.
Build works for me both for VS 2015 and 2013, both from VS and from command-line.
Excellent! All we need now is confirmation that this works for machines with _only_ Visual Studio 2013 installed. @shulmanb, can you test that?

Will do that on Monday.

-----Original Message-----
From: "Markus Weimer" notifications@github.com
Sent: 3/12/2016 3:56 PM
To: "apache/reef" reef@noreply.github.com
Cc: "Boris Shulman" shulmanb@gmail.com
Subject: Re: [reef] [REEF-743] Convert project files to Visual Studio 2015(#873)

Excellent! All we need now is confirmation that this works for machines with only Visual Studio 2013 installed. @shulmanb, can you test that?

Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
@markusweimer I responded to your questions on the Jira.

Thanks, lifting my -1

Will do a pass now.

Done with my pass. Left one typo-comment.

Once concern: How do C# developers know which magic strings to use to name their runtimes? Should we make it more explicit than strings?

I tried it with the machine which has only VS 2013 installed, both build and test are passed. 

Must install maven 3.3.x though. That is required by the latest change for build script, not related to VS 2015.

Oh, I thought our build instructions at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/REEF/Compiling+REEF require 3.3, but they're actually "3 or newer". 3.2 and older don't support some of the switches I used. We should update build instructions with REEF-1254
Thanks, @jwang98052! Can we go ahead and merge this, then?
